Chapter 3, Section 3 of the First Part: The Chapter on Correspondence
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not become attached to the existence of eye contact, do not become attached to the non-existence of eye contact, do not become attached to the existence of ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact, do not become attached to the non-existence of ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact;

They do not become attached to the permanence of eye contact, do not become attached to the impermanence of eye contact, do not become attached to the permanence of ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact, do not become attached to the impermanence of ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact;

They do not become attached to the happiness of eye contact, do not become attached to the suffering of eye contact, do not become attached to the happiness of ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact, do not become attached to the suffering of ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact;
They do not grasp eye contact as self or as non-self, and they do not grasp ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact as self or as non-self;
They do not grasp eye contact as calm or as not calm, and they do not grasp ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact as calm or as not calm;
They do not grasp eye contact as empty or as not empty, and they do not grasp ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact as empty or as not empty;
They do not grasp eye contact as signless or as with signs, and they do not grasp ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact as signless or as with signs;

They are not attached to the non-aspiration of eye contact, and not attached to the aspiration of eye contact. They are not attached to the non-aspiration of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact, and not attached to the aspiration of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, it is said that they are in accordance with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ are not attached to the existence of the feelings produced from the condition of eye contact, and not attached to the non-existence of the feelings produced from the condition of eye contact. They are not attached to the existence of the feelings produced from the condition of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact, and not attached to the non-existence of the feelings produced from the condition of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact;

They do not cling to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of pleasant and unpleasant feelings, and they do not cling to the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-contact as a condition for the arising of pleasant and unpleasant feelings.ğŸ”½They do not cling to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of pleasant and unpleasant feelings, and they do not cling to the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-contact as a condition for the arising of pleasant and unpleasant feelings.

They do not cling to the eye-contact as a condition for the arising of pleasant and unpleasant feelings, and they do not cling to the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-contact as a condition for the arising of pleasant and unpleasant feelings.
They do not cling to the eye-contact-born feelings as being calm or not calm, and they do not cling to the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, or mind-contact-born feelings as being calm or not calm;
They do not cling to the eye-contact-born feelings as being empty or not empty, and they do not cling to the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, or mind-contact-born feelings as being empty or not empty;

They do not grasp the eye contact as a condition for the arising of feelings as signless, and they do not grasp the eye contact as a condition for the arising of feelings as having signs; they do not grasp the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact as a condition for the arising of feelings as signless, and they do not grasp the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact as a condition for the arising of feelings as having signs;

They do not grasp the eye contact as a condition for the arising of feelings as wishless, and they do not grasp the eye contact as a condition for the arising of feelings as having wishes; they do not grasp the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact as a condition for the arising of feelings as wishless, and they do not grasp the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact as a condition for the arising of feelings as having wishes.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accordance with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not become attached to the existence of the earth element, do not become attached to the non-existence of the earth element, do not become attached to the existence of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, and do not become attached to the non-existence of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

They do not become attached to the permanence of the earth element, do not become attached to the impermanence of the earth element, do not become attached to the permanence of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, and do not become attached to the impermanence of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

They do not become attached to the happiness of the earth element, do not become attached to the suffering of the earth element, do not become attached to the happiness of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, and do not become attached to the suffering of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

They do not become attached to the self of the earth element, do not become attached to the non-self of the earth element, do not become attached to the self of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, and do not become attached to the non-self of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

They do not cling to the quiescence of the earth element, nor do they cling to the non-quiescence of the earth element; they do not cling to the quiescence of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, nor do they cling to the non-quiescence of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

they do not cling to the emptiness of the earth element, nor do they cling to the non-emptiness of the earth element; they do not cling to the emptiness of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, nor do they cling to the non-emptiness of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

they do not cling to the signlessness of the earth element, nor do they cling to the signlessness of the earth element; they do not cling to the signlessness of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, nor do they cling to the signlessness of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

they do not cling to the wishlessness of the earth element, nor do they cling to the wishlessness of the earth element; they do not cling to the wishlessness of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, nor do they cling to the wishlessness of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, not attached to the existence of causes and conditions, not attached to the non-existence of causes and conditions, not attached to the existence of the immediately preceding conditions, the object conditions, and the dominant conditions, and the dharmas produced from conditions, not attached to the non-existence of the immediately preceding conditions, the object conditions, the dominant conditions, and the dharmas produced from conditions;

not attached to the permanence of causes and conditions, not attached to the impermanence of causes and conditions, not attached to the permanence of the immediately preceding conditions, the object conditions, the dominant conditions, and the dharmas produced from conditions, not attached to the impermanence of the immediately preceding conditions, the object conditions, the dominant conditions, and the dharmas produced from conditions;

They do not become attached to the pleasure or suffering of conditions, nor to the pleasure or suffering of the immediately preceding conditions, the object conditions, the dominant conditions, or the dharmas produced from conditions;ğŸ”½They do not become attached to the self or non-self of conditions, nor to the self or non-self of the immediately preceding conditions, the object conditions, the dominant conditions, or the dharmas produced from conditions;

They do not become attached to the quiescence or non-quiescence of conditions, nor to the quiescence or non-quiescence of the immediately preceding conditions, the object conditions, the dominant conditions, or the dharmas produced from conditions;

They do not cling to the emptiness of conditions, nor do they cling to the non-emptiness of conditions; they do not cling to the emptiness of the immediately preceding condition, the object condition, the dominant condition, and the dharmas produced from conditions, nor do they cling to the non-emptiness of the immediately preceding condition, the object condition, the dominant condition, and the dharmas produced from conditions;ğŸ”½They do not cling to the signlessness of conditions, nor do they cling to the signlessness of conditions; they do not cling to the signlessness of the immediately preceding condition, the object condition, the dominant condition, and the dharmas produced from conditions, nor do they cling to the signlessness of the immediately preceding condition, the object condition, the dominant condition, and the dharmas produced from conditions;

They do not cling to the wishlessness of conditions, nor do they cling to the wishlessness of conditions; they do not cling to the wishlessness of the immediately preceding condition, the object condition, the dominant condition, and the dharmas produced from conditions, nor do they cling to the wishlessness of the immediately preceding condition, the object condition, the dominant condition, and the dharmas produced from conditions.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ without attachment to the existence of ignorance, without attachment to the non-existence of ignorance, without attachment to the existence of formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression and anguish, without attachment to the non-existence of formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression and anguish;

without attachment to the permanence of ignorance, without attachment to the impermanence of ignorance, without attachment to the permanence of formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression and anguish, without attachment to the impermanence of formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression and anguish;
They do not cling to the pleasure or suffering of ignorance, nor do they cling to the pleasure or suffering of volitional formations up to old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress;
They do not cling to the self or non-self of ignorance, nor do they cling to the self or non-self of volitional formations up to old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress;

They do not cling to the quiescence or non-quiescence of ignorance, nor do they cling to the quiescence or non-quiescence of volitional formations up to old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress;

They do not cling to the emptiness or non-emptiness of ignorance, nor do they cling to the emptiness or non-emptiness of volitional formations up to old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress;

They do not become attached to the signlessness of ignorance, nor do they become attached to the sign of ignorance; they do not become attached to the signlessness of volitional formations up to old age and death, and they do not become attached to the sign of volitional formations up to old age and death.

They do not become attached to the wishlessness of ignorance, nor do they become attached to the wishfulness of ignorance; they do not become attached to the wishlessness of volitional formations up to old age and death, and they do not become attached to the wishfulness of volitional formations up to old age and death.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, it is said that they are in accordance with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not become attached to the existence of the perfection of giving, do not become attached to the non-existence of the perfection of giving, do not become attached to the existence of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, do not become attached to the non-existence of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom;

do not become attached to the permanence of the perfection of giving, do not become attached to the impermanence of the perfection of giving, do not become attached to the permanence of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, do not become attached to the impermanence of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom;

They do not become attached to the joy of the perfection of giving, nor to the suffering of the perfection of giving; they do not become attached to the joy of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, nor to the suffering of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom;

they do not become attached to the self of the perfection of giving, nor to the non-self of the perfection of giving; they do not become attached to the self of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, nor to the non-self of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom;

They do not become attached to the tranquility of the perfection of giving, nor to the non-tranquility of the perfection of giving; they do not become attached to the tranquility of the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, nor to the non-tranquility of the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom;

they do not become attached to the emptiness of the perfection of giving, nor to the non-emptiness of the perfection of giving; they do not become attached to the emptiness of the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, nor to the non-emptiness of the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom;

They do not become attached to the signlessness of the perfection of giving, nor do they become attached to the sign of the perfection of giving; they do not become attached to the signlessness of the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, nor do they become attached to the sign of the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom;

they do not become attached to the wishlessness of the perfection of giving, nor do they become attached to the wishlessness of the perfection of giving; they do not become attached to the wishlessness of the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, nor do they become attached to the wishlessness of the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accordance with the perfection of wisdom.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not grasp at the existence of inner emptiness, do not grasp at the non-existence of inner emptiness, do not grasp at outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of self-nature, or emptiness of the nature of self-nature; they do not grasp at the non-existence of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of self-nature;

they do not grasp at the permanence of inner emptiness, do not grasp at the impermanence of inner emptiness, do not grasp at the permanence of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of self-nature, do not grasp at the impermanence of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of self-nature;

They do not delight in the joy of the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor do they delight in the suffering of the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor do they delight in the joy of the emptiness of external phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, nor do they delight in the suffering of the emptiness of external phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence;

They do not grasp at a self in the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor do they grasp at a self in the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor do they grasp at a self in the emptiness of external phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, nor do they grasp at a self in the emptiness of external phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence;ğŸ”½They do not delight in the tranquility of the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor do they delight in the agitation of the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor do they delight in the tranquility of the emptiness of external phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, nor do they delight in the agitation of the emptiness of external phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence;

They do not delight in the emptiness of the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor do they delight in the non-emptiness of the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor do they delight in the emptiness of the emptiness of external phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, nor do they delight in the non-emptiness of the emptiness of external phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence;

They do not cling to the signlessness of internal emptiness, nor do they cling to the sign of internal emptiness; they do not cling to the signlessness of external emptiness up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence, nor do they cling to the sign of external emptiness up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence;

they do not cling to the wishlessness of internal emptiness, nor do they cling to the wish of internal emptiness; they do not cling to the wishlessness of external emptiness up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence, nor do they cling to the wish of external emptiness up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not grasp at the existence of true suchness, do not grasp at the non-existence of true suchness, do not grasp at the existence or non-existence of the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, unarisen nature, dharma determination, dharma abiding, reality limit, space realm, or inconceivable realm;ğŸ”½they do not grasp at the permanence of true suchness, do not grasp at the impermanence of true suchness, do not grasp at the permanence or impermanence of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm;
they do not grasp at the bliss of true suchness, do not grasp at the suffering of true suchness, do not grasp at the bliss or suffering of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm;

They do not grasp at a self in true suchness, nor do they grasp at a non-self in true suchness; they do not grasp at a self in the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm, nor do they grasp at a non-self in the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm.

They do not grasp at the quiescence of true suchness, nor do they grasp at the non-quiescence of true suchness; they do not grasp at the quiescence of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm, nor do they grasp at the non-quiescence of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm.

They do not grasp at the emptiness of true suchness, nor do they grasp at the non-emptiness of true suchness; they do not grasp at the emptiness of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm, nor do they grasp at the non-emptiness of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm.

They do not grasp at the signlessness of true suchness, nor do they grasp at the signlessness of true suchness; they do not grasp at the signlessness of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm, nor do they grasp at the signs of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm.

They do not grasp the signlessness of suchness, and they do not grasp the signlessness of suchness as a sign. They do not grasp the wishlessness of suchness, and they do not grasp the wishlessness of suchness as a sign. They do not grasp the emptiness of suchness, and they do not grasp the emptiness of suchness as a sign. They do not grasp the signlessness of suchness, and they do not grasp the signlessness of suchness as a sign. They do not grasp the wishlessness of suchness, and they do not grasp the wishlessness of suchness as a sign.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, it is said that they are in accordance with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not grasp the existence of the four establishments of mindfulness, and they do not grasp the non-existence of the four establishments of mindfulness. They do not grasp the existence of the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path, and they do not grasp the non-existence of the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path;

They do not cling to the permanence of the four establishments of mindfulness, nor to their impermanence; they do not cling to the permanence or impermanence of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path;

They do not cling to the happiness of the four establishments of mindfulness, nor to their suffering; they do not cling to the happiness or suffering of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path;
They do not cling to the self of the four establishments of mindfulness, nor to their non-self; they do not cling to the self or non-self of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path;

They do not cling to the tranquility of the four establishments of mindfulness, nor to their agitation; they do not cling to the tranquility or agitation of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path;

They do not cling to the emptiness of the four establishments of mindfulness, nor do they cling to the non-emptiness of the four establishments of mindfulness; they do not cling to the emptiness of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path, nor do they cling to the non-emptiness of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path;ğŸ”½they do not cling to the signlessness of the four establishments of mindfulness, nor do they cling to the signlessness of the four establishments of mindfulness; they do not cling to the signlessness of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path, nor do they cling to the signlessness of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path;

they do not cling to the wishlessness of the four establishments of mindfulness, nor do they cling to the wishlessness of the four establishments of mindfulness; they do not cling to the wishlessness of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path, nor do they cling to the wishlessness of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, it is said that they are in accordance with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not become attached to the existence of the noble truth of suffering, nor do they become attached to the non-existence of the noble truth of suffering, nor do they become attached to the existence of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path, nor do they become attached to the non-existence of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path;

They do not become attached to the permanence of the noble truth of suffering, nor do they become attached to the impermanence of the noble truth of suffering, nor do they become attached to the permanence of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path, nor do they become attached to the impermanence of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path;

They do not become attached to the happiness of the noble truth of suffering, nor do they become attached to the suffering of the noble truth of suffering, nor do they become attached to the happiness of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path, nor do they become attached to the suffering of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path;

They do not become attached to the self of the noble truth of suffering, nor do they become attached to the non-self of the noble truth of suffering, nor do they become attached to the self of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path, nor do they become attached to the non-self of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path;
They do not cling to the noble truth of suffering as tranquil or not tranquil, and they do not cling to the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering as tranquil or not tranquil;
They do not cling to the noble truth of suffering as empty or not empty, and they do not cling to the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering as empty or not empty;
They do not cling to the noble truth of suffering as signless or with signs, and they do not cling to the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering as signless or with signs;
They do not cling to the noble truth of suffering as wishless or with wishes, and they do not cling to the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering as wishless or with wishes.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ without attachment to the existence of the four concentrations, without attachment to the non-existence of the four concentrations, without attachment to the existence of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations, without attachment to the non-existence of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations;

without attachment to the permanence of the four concentrations, without attachment to the impermanence of the four concentrations, without attachment to the permanence of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations, without attachment to the impermanence of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations;

without attachment to the happiness of the four concentrations, without attachment to the suffering of the four concentrations, without attachment to the happiness of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations, without attachment to the suffering of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations;
They do not grasp at the self of the four formless concentrations, nor do they grasp at the non-self of the four formless concentrations;

They do not grasp at the quiescence of the four formless concentrations, nor do they grasp at the non-quiescence of the four formless concentrations;ğŸ”½They do not grasp at the emptiness of the four formless concentrations, nor do they grasp at the non-emptiness of the four formless concentrations;ğŸ”½They do not grasp at the signlessness of the four formless concentrations, nor do they grasp at the signlessness of the four formless concentrations;
They are not attached to the four formless concentrations as having aspirations, nor are they attached to the four formless concentrations as being without aspirations.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ accord with such dharmas, it is said they accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ are not attached to the eight liberations as existent, nor are they attached to the eight liberations as nonexistent; they are not attached to the eight superior [meditative] states, nine sequential [meditative] attainments, and ten universal bases as existent, nor are they attached to the eight superior [meditative] states, nine sequential [meditative] attainments, and ten universal bases as nonexistent;

They do not cling to the eight liberations as permanent, nor do they cling to the eight liberations as impermanent; they do not cling to the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential attainments, or the ten universal bases as permanent, nor do they cling to the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential attainments, or the ten universal bases as impermanent;

They do not cling to the eight liberations as blissful, nor do they cling to the eight liberations as suffering; they do not cling to the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential attainments, or the ten universal bases as blissful, nor do they cling to the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential attainments, or the ten universal bases as suffering;

They do not cling to the eight liberations as having a self, nor do they cling to the eight liberations as being without a self; they do not cling to the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential attainments, or the ten universal bases as having a self, nor do they cling to the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential attainments, or the ten universal bases as being without a self;

They do not cling to the eight liberations as tranquil, nor do they cling to the eight liberations as not tranquil; they do not cling to the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential attainments, or the ten universal bases as tranquil, nor do they cling to the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential attainments, or the ten universal bases as not tranquil;

They do not cling to the emptiness of the eight liberations, nor do they cling to the non-emptiness of the eight liberations; they do not cling to the emptiness of the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and the ten universal [totalities], nor do they cling to the non-emptiness of the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and the ten universal [totalities].ğŸ”½They do not cling to the signlessness of the eight liberations, nor do they cling to the signlessness of the eight liberations; they do not cling to the signlessness of the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and the ten universal [totalities], nor do they cling to the signlessness of the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and the ten universal [totalities].

They do not cling to the wishlessness of the eight liberations, nor do they cling to the wishlessness of the eight liberations; they do not cling to the wishlessness of the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and the ten universal [totalities], nor do they cling to the wishlessness of the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and the ten universal [totalities].
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, it is said that they are in accordance with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not grasp at the existence of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways, and do not grasp at their non-existence;
they do not grasp at the permanence or impermanence of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways;
